history.content:
I think my 2 GB Chromebook occasionally had memory issues when I tried to video chat while having too many windows open.

4 GB is more than enough for academic purposes.

----------------------------------------------------------

I have a 2015 macbook pro with 8gb ram that has never had issues when it comes to working on cs projects while having other processes running at the same time. In general, most cs projects won't even come close to heavily taxing your computer at all.

--------------------------------------------------------

8GB Asus Windows laptop.  Can work on code + multiple browser tabs + Skype without any noticeable slow down.

--------------------------------------------------------

For schoolwork that's enough.  However, if you are interested in doing some outside projects that require more demanding resources (a phone emulator for mobile dev, or using it to run multiple VMs perhaps), it may be worth it to get 16 gb.

--------------------------------------------------------

While 8GB is definitely enough, I'd probably say future-proof your purchase and get the 16GB model. It's not that your CS projects will benefit from the extra RAM, but you'll have a much smoother experience when multitasking.

buying a macbook pro that I can't upgrade later. is 8gb ram enough or will 16gb ram provide a noticeable performance boost for cs projects/assignments? multitasking with at least a dozen chrome tabs + spotify + video chat in background. thanks!
history.subject: how much ram for cs?
